result.execSummary:
The defendant Ky D Larson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ky D Larson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ky D Larson was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $114.50 court costs.  $250 bond to be applied & remainder is to be held upon submission of attorney fees.
Eligible for expungement upon successful completion of probation.

Must undergo COMPAS evaluation and follow through with criminogenic needs as recommended by Probation.

If probation feels appropriate, may petition for early discharge after 1/2 of term has been cmopleted.

Follow requirements of Probation.

14CF3-Count 2-30 days PCJ, consec to count 7 & 8 in 14CF227.  Subj to GT & WR.

CASES: 14CF227, 14TR1, 14TR2, 14CF126, 14CF3. Defendant Ky D. Larson in court with attorney Mark Drew Biller.  Stephen C. Dorrance appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CW-clerk 9:01 am.
14CF3-Count 2-NC plea.  CT-accept plea, adj guilty.
14CF227-Count 7-NC plea.  CT-accept plea, adj guilty.  Count 8-NC plea.  CT-accept plea, adj guilty.  
All remaining counts/matters including TR's are dismissed w/ prej.
SENTENCE:  CT finds elig for expungement upon successful completion of probation.  W/H sentence, probation up to 18 mo on ea (concurrent).  If probation feels appropriate may petition for early discharge after 1/2 of term completed.  COMPAS.  Follow requirements of probation.  No illegal/controlled substances.  DNA surcharge is waived.  Costs of $114.50 as to count 2 in 14CF3.  Court cost waived in other file.  Bond to be applied & remainder to be held upon submission of atty fees.  PCR.  Must report to probation today.  9:19 am adj.
